article.title: Origin of Non-axisymmetric Features of Virgo Cluster Early-type Dwarf Galaxies. I. Bar Formation and Recurrent Buckling

choices: The Toomre stability parameter of VCC856
The rotation curve of VCC856 compared to model S1
The evolution of the bar pattern speed in model S1

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 1(b), what do the different colored lines represent?
choices: Different values of the halo concentration parameter
Different values of the mean streaming parameter
Different values of the disk scale height
Different values of the total disk mass

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main conclusion drawn from comparing the rotation curve of VCC856 to the model S1 in Figure 1(a)?
choices: VCC856 is likely dominated by dark matter
VCC856 requires the presence of counter-rotating particles to match the observed rotation
VCC856 is intrinsically unstable to forming bars
VCC856 has experienced significant tidal interactions

multiple_choice_question.text: Based on Figure 1(b), how does the mean streaming parameter affect the rotation curve?
choices: A higher mean streaming parameter results in a higher overall rotation velocity
A lower mean streaming parameter results in a steeper rise in the rotation curve
The mean streaming parameter has no noticeable effect on the rotation curve
A higher mean streaming parameter leads to a more flattened rotation curve at larger radii
